entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Through Alaska Range Passes Late Tuesday Night and Wednesday... South winds gusting over 50 mph are expected through Alaska Range Passes after midnight Tuesday night through Wednesday. The strongest winds will be near Healy, and south of of Delta Junction.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... The northwest Interior received 2 to 5 inches of rainfall over the past week, with the heaviest amounts in the Upper Kobuk, Upper Noatak, and lower Koyukuk Valleys. entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Tuesday and Wednesday Along The West Coast From the Bering Strait To The Yukon Delta... A strong storm developing in Eastern Russia today will move along the West Coast of Alaska on Tuesday, and into the Interior by Wednesday. This will bring south winds of 25 to 40 mph to the West Coast on Tuesday that will decrease slowly Tue night and Wed.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL COLBERT COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 745 PM CDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However heavy rain is still possible with this thunderstorm.
